title: Pablo Zabaleta loves Manchester so much that he even misses the RAIN when he's not there
text:

They might have all the money in the world now, but there is little doubt that the £6.4m Manchester City spent on Pablo Zabaleta in the summer of 2008 was one of the club's best ever pieces of business. 
After arriving from Espanyol, the Argentinean defender has gone on to become a part of the furniture at the Etihad Stadium , winning two Premier League titles and generally taking on legendary status with the club's fans. 
And it seems as though the city of Manchester has left its mark on the 32-year-old, who even loves the city's famously inclement weather. He loves the club, and the club loves him (Photo: Reuters) Pablo's a big Manchester fan (Photo: Clive Mason) 
Speaking in the new issue of Four Four Two magazine, Zabaleta said: “This place has definitely changed me. 
"When I go on holiday to Spain for a month in the summer with the family, or somewhere with more sunshine, I find that I miss all the rain in Manchester. It sounds crazy, but it’s true." 
No Pablo, it is crazy.
